item.title: Door gfx - I AM HEPING AND I GET NO HELP :(
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:21, topic:426671”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=529369.msg3862880#msg3862880 date=1324767970]
Like this?

				case 11721:
			if(obX == 2981 && obY == 3340) {
				c.getPA().object(2981, 3340, 11721, -1, 0);
			}

[/quote]

If it doesn’t do anything then change the Face. If it still doesn’t work, use a different click packet.[/quote]
I tried everything but nothing works… Can you tell me some faces I can use for this?

item.title: Door gfx - I AM HEPING AND I GET NO HELP :(
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:16, topic:426671”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=529369.msg3862760#msg3862760 date=1324764646]

case 11721:
                if (c.objectX == 2981 && c.objectY == 3340){
               replaceobject 1519
                }
                break;

That won’t work, but that’s what you’re wanting. Lol and you wanted to work with me. :rolleyes:

No need to be rude :(.

I wasn’t being rude lol, I was being real. Do you still need help?

You know what I mean :p. And sorta, I still dont get the replace thing…

Find your replace object method. You’re wanting to use it so that when you click the door, it replaces the object you clicked (the door) with the same object, except facing a different direction. This is how most servers handle opening doors.

Is there an ID for north and south and stuff? what would you put after replaceobject. I get what your saying but I don’t know how to add that.

It should be in the method like this:

-1, 0, 1, ect.

Those are the facing directions.

Ahh, it’s just like delta’s door.cfg.

Yes, except it actually works. Rep is appreciated but not needed.
[/quote]
I have reped you already for your Z-317.

Would it be like this:

case 11721: if (c.objectX == 2981 && c.objectY == 3340){ replaceobject 0 -1 -1 1 0 break; } [/quote]

Jesus… lol. Yes, except a piece of actual code.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:15, topic:426671”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=529369.msg3862756#msg3862756 date=1324764573]

case 11721:
                if (c.objectX == 2981 && c.objectY == 3340){
               replaceobject 1519
                }
                break;

That won’t work, but that’s what you’re wanting. Lol and you wanted to work with me. :rolleyes:

No need to be rude :(.

I wasn’t being rude lol, I was being real. Do you still need help?

You know what I mean :p. And sorta, I still dont get the replace thing…

Find your replace object method. You’re wanting to use it so that when you click the door, it replaces the object you clicked (the door) with the same object, except facing a different direction. This is how most servers handle opening doors.

Is there an ID for north and south and stuff? what would you put after replaceobject. I get what your saying but I don’t know how to add that.

It should be in the method like this:

-1, 0, 1, ect.

Those are the facing directions.

Ahh, it’s just like delta’s door.cfg.
[/quote]

Yes, except it actually works. Rep is appreciated but not needed.[/quote]
I have reped you already for your Z-317.

Would it be like this:

		case 11721:
            if (c.objectX == 2981 && c.objectY == 3340){
               replaceobject 0        -1        -1        1        0
				break;
			}

item.title: Door gfx - I AM HEPING AND I GET NO HELP :(
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

What in the world is the door gfx. I add this:

		case 11721:
			if (c.objectY == 3340) {
				if (c.absY >= c.objectY)
				c.getPA().walkTo(0,-1);
			else
					c.getPA().walkTo(0,1);
				break;
			}

But it doesn’t do anything. Now I am doing:

case 11721:
                if (c.objectX == 2981 && c.objectY == 3340){
                c.startAnimation(###);
                }
                break;

And I can’t find the GFX for doors. I’m not sure how to add a door, so if this is incorrect than can you tell me how to make one?

Thanks,
Arham

Read full topic
item.source: Door gfx - I AM HEPING AND I GET NO HELP :(
